positive_comments: AI is such a new and evolving field of study, it is a great start to provide this course. The structure of the course with video of 5-6 minutes is very effective. The addition of podcasts by Benard Marr were well placed. The article was helpful. The chapter of ROI is essential. As companies roll out different AI tools, many keep saying a ROI will appear overtime. Usually withing the first quarter, you will be able to determine whether or not the tool is useful overtime. You may even be able to ask chatgpt for example. The proposed question of "Can We Trust Artificial Intelligence?" by Caltech was a nice addition for deeper analysis that can be applied to ethics. The module opens as a great overview or AI and proposes questions for more study and individual business implementation.
improvement_opportunities: Overall, it looks like the videos and articles are dated in 2022. The business world of AI has moved with rapid speed. You may want to consider more updated videos and materials. In the future, I am assuming the instructor in this course is an AI. Maybe, you can add choices of AI instructors and voices.  Because this is module 1,I'm sure the course evolves in updates.

positive_comments: This module 2 has more variation in instruction or a different AI Present. The animation video for Convolutional Neural Networks was entertaining. It provokes more questions and study in programming or the coding. There appeared many introductions for items for more study with (CNN).  The focus on customers was valuable. The real world business examples such as in education and retailers gives a broad perspective. The focus on FOX using AI with the audience and customers gives a mediated prospect to incorporate in social mediated business models.  There were better articles and videos to implement specific to business use and to add value to customers.  Overall. this was a great module focused on practical use in audience and customers. the capstone will provide students with a action plan in their businesses.
improvement_opportunities: Overall, this was a more engaging module than module 1. There are some videos with in the presentations that could be improved. They appear as just background entertainment. When the instructor is talking about machines and it's just a video of cars in a city.

positive_comments: Great resources with valuable information, especially on the AI marketplace today.
improvement_opportunities: Could include more real-life or daily applications and examples of AI to demonstrate its capacity and capabilities.

positive_comments: Extremely information and opened up new doors into the world of AI. The downloading of transcripts for the module is really helpful, and have not seen this done in other courses.  It helps those who might not always have audio excess to keep up with the course and includes space for note taking. Excellent improvement.
improvement_opportunities: Again, incorporating more daily use and examples of AI helps those new to the topic to grasp it further and eases them into learning about such technology that otherwise is incomprehensible to many.

positive_comments: This module was fantastic!  The topic is very relevant with a lot of interest and organizations are all looking at how to positively implement and use AI.  The glossary and the transcript at the beginning of the modules is a great idea. As I went through the model I would start to formulate questions and then the next section would answer them!  The short video clips were helpful to absorb information.  There is so much information that it’s a lot to digest so the format and useful resources added at the end were also helpful.  Lots of strong takeaways!
improvement_opportunities: I’m curious who the specific audience will be for the course and how it will be listed ie Business, IT, etc?   The reason I ask I am a long term Finance & Strategy leader, so as I look at the case study and my role in an organization, I would be involved in the decisions and strategy across business functions.  So it’s very relevant to my role and easy to follow and apply the case study.  But I wonder for new managers in an organization would the case study become very overwhelming for them?  They would likely need to interact with other business functions to understand the implementation, need and use side.  (My opinion). In my opinion this module is very useful for Senior Executives and Board Directors.

positive_comments: The case studies were very interesting and helpful in understanding AI in and across Industries.  As mentioned above as well the inclusion of the transcript and ability to add notes is a good addition.  The content was incredible and format well done to facilitate learning.
improvement_opportunities: Two areas I wanted to hear more about in this module…. In relation to industries, will we start to see AI Standardization across industries?  What will the best practices to be implemented by industry? The section that discusses up skilling of employees - are there any case studies with Amazon or others that could be included that demonstrate the before and after for some of these roles?  It would be helpful to have this to better understand some of the employee development needs. A small tech note - some of the articles take a very long time to open or get stuck so I would have to exit the section and go back a few times for it to come up.  I work on an IPad which my be part of the issue but thought I would mention.

positive_comments: I found the content to be both fascinating and relevant.  I especially appreciated how current trends were addressed, such as Emotional Intelligence, Upskilling and Change Management. I've been working with clients on these very topics and know how important they are to a business.  I liked the strategies that were shared to implement any challenges that were mentioned. The instructor was easy to listen to and excited about sharing the information. I was kept engaged watching the videos as there were packed with powerful content and able to be viewed in bite-sized pieces and interspersed with discussions, articles and discussions. The downloads and resources were very helpful as well.  Understanding how AI is used in so many different industries and what positions were at risk was very interesting and eye-opening.  Well done.
improvement_opportunities: I don't think there is anything to make the course better. There is something that if it can be fixed would be good.  In Module 3, Section 6, the end of the video was cut off mid-sentence.  It said "This is essential" and then the video was over.  It makes me curious as to what was essential.

positive_comments: The information in this video had my attention as it talked about AI adoption, education, experience and success.  There are so many different pieces to AI adoption and each section offered reasons to consider as well as the value in adoption. As I mentioned in Module 3,  I was engaged watching the videos as there were packed with powerful content and able to be viewed in bite-sized pieces and interspersed with discussions, articles and discussions. The downloads and resources were very helpful as well.  Whether you are a business owner, corporate executive or entrepreneur, the education and discussion on the experience are definitely something to watch and listen to. I was amazed at how much I didn't know and/or took for granted.  Thank you.
improvement_opportunities: I thought the instructor was less conversational than the one in Module 3. While the material was great, it seemed like more of a lecture and/or reading the information and less engaging. Also in section 6, two of the slides have the description he was reading reversed. The information on the GE slide was reversed with the information on the BofA slide.

positive_comments: Module 3 had some really good ideas on how to make immediate impact with the use of AI and really broke down what AI in certain industries looks like. There was a good mix of videos, assignments and reading materials. All in all this module is very imformative.
improvement_opportunities: The video numbered 6 out of 13 ended middesentence at 5:32 -- it seems like the last though of the speaker got cut off.

positive_comments: Module 1 met the foundational knowledge goals for the course which are to show students how AI is longer an IT function but one that spans data science to marketing to medicine. It also showed how there are more opportunities in the workforce for people who are ready to learn and that AI combined with human supervision is an ideal path forward.  The course resources including videos and prepared materials where high quality, well presented and varied and most importantly, they are relevant.
improvement_opportunities: However, the  below recommended resources in the introduction seemed to be geared towards the digital marketing and influence market.  ChatGPT Passive Income Blueprint: The Quick-Start Guide to Making Money with Artificial Intelligence, by Eugene McKinney, March 2023  The ChatGPT Millionaire: Making Money Online has never been this easy, by Neil Dagger, January 2023
Having real life use cases from executives/companies practicing AI
